name: Thumbnail Editor
author: aviplugins.com

sections.description:
When images are uploaded in the WordPress Media library section WordPress creates some thumbnails of that image. The size of these thumbnail images can be mentioned in the Settings->Media section.

But there can be some big issues with these thumbnails. WordPress Crop/Resize these images dynamically when you upload an image. When thumbnails are CROPPED it is very much possible that it gets CROPPED from the wrong section of the uploaded image. This can produce some BAD looking thumbnail images. Which doesn’t look good in frontend of the site. This plugin will allow you to update those thumbnail images manually. The thumbnail image edit interface that this plugin provides is simple and very easy to use.

The shortcodes and functions are provided in the image editor page of the plugin.

Image editor links can be found in WordPress Media Library.

Image files that can be edited are JPG, JPEG, GIF and PNG

Thumbnail Editor PRO

Checkout the PRO version features here. PRO version costs only USD 2.00

  • Support for Amazon S3 Bucket.
  • Completely replace thumbnail images and upload new ones.
  • Add Custom Texts to thumbnail images. You can add signature in the images.
  • Different Text Fonts are available to choose from.
  • Add Image Effects like Gray Scale, Sketch, Negative or Add Color Effects to the Image.
  • Add image Borders with different border colors.
  • Option to Revert Back the changes you made in the image.
sections.installation:
1. Upload thumbnail-editor.zip to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory.
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress.
  3. Now go to Media->Library and in the files list you should see the “Crop Thumbnail” link.
  4. Click on the link to start editing the images.
sections.faq:
For any kind of problem

  1. Please email me at demoforafo@gmail.com for any queries or Contact me here https://www.aviplugins.com/support.php

short_description: Manually Crop and Resize thumbnail images that are uploaded in the Media section.
